intro: Ophiorrhiza palauensis var. biseta, commonly known as the Palau banyan, is a unique tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, in the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
